name: Responsive Google Map
author: Jogesh Sharma

sections.description:
Responsive Google Map helps you to integrate Google Map to your WordPress website with very handy interface. You can easily customize your google map with custom markers, locations, descriptions, images and link and integrate it anywhere. We required the Google Map API key to make it working.

Create Simple Map

Docs & Support

You can find docs. If you can’t locate any topics that pertain to your particular issue, post a new topic for it. You can directly use the
shortcode for in your widget area too.

New in version 3.1

  • Introduced RGM Maps widget
  • Improved Backend UI
  • Introduced new styles for your Google Map
  • Now get Latitude, Longitude by Location by Address link ( requires Geocoding Service )

New in version 3.0.0

  • Droped jQuery from WordPress Backend
  • You can add as many Maps as you want.
  • You can use more then one map on frontend side.
  • Upgrade – Upgraded UI

Updates

  1. Lightwight
  2. Easy Interface with customizable settings
  3. Implement Map Anywhere
sections.installation:
1. Upload the entire responsive-google-map folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.

For basic usage, you can also have a look at the plugin homepage.
sections.faq:
Do you have questions or issues with Responsive Google Map? Use these support channels appropriately.

  1. Docs
  2. FAQ

Support

upgrade_notice.1.1: Implementing the add radius functionality around the marker in miles. Small performance issues fixes.
